channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Excessive dog fouling & rubbish, 15th January
item.description:
I’m writing to complain about the excessive dog fouling taking place in Inver Close. The green area is disgusting and the residents are not cleaning up after their pets. Children walk this route to school. We need a bin and sign added to the green area.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Inver Close, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipping, 15th January
item.description:
Rubbish from 244 dumped outside property and spilling over into adjoining property and onto pavement. Causing an obstruction to pavement and access to adjoining property for at least one month.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Brownhill Road, Catford South, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Giant Christmas tree, 15th January
item.description:
Enormous tree dumped and blocking pavement for over a week. Rubbish dumped behind it was removed but giant tree remains and pavement impassable.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Huge pot hole, 15th January
item.description:
There's a massive pot hole on this road. It needs to be filled immediately! I nearly fell off my motorbike.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 74, Barnfield Wood Road, Park Langley, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pothole in Boxall Road. On the oppisite side of the road to 29 Boxall Road, 15th January
item.description:
Its getting bigger and needs attention as soon as possible. Thank you.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Boxall Road, Dulwich Village, Greater London

item.title: Bikes blocking pavement around 55 BakerStreet building Blandford street/dorset street/BakerStreet, 15th January
item.description:
Human forest and lime bikes blocking pavement around 55 baker street building Blandford street/baker street/dorset street need to clear out and fix it causing hazard and nuisance.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 55, Baker Street, Marylebone, City of Westminster

item.title: Linwood Close road sign has vanished, 15th January
item.description:
Linwood Close street sign disappeared overnight about 6 weeks ago. Location is at the junction of Linwood Close and Chadwick Road. It’s very difficult for motorists and local residents to identify from the main road where they are and the correct turning when driving.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1-11, Linwood Close, Peckham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The rainwater is not subsiding, 15th January
item.description:
The drain is not emptying the rainwater and it is now above the street level and it is directly in front of my drive

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Victoria Road, Bexley, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: School keep clear markings shouldn't be on the road, 15th January
item.description:
Dear Hackney Council, we had a school on our road which was demolished about a year ago now. But the school keep clear markings are still there. We would really appreciate if these markings were cleared and more parking bays are done for us.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Big Hill, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Outside 78 Kingsgate Road NW6, 15th January
item.description:
Despite work carried out a year or two ago drain is still blocked and flooding pavement and parking area.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 80, Kingsgate Road, Kilburn, Greater London

item.title: Blocked drain, 15th January

item.title: Abandoned tyre left on pavement, 15th January
item.description:
An abandoned tyre has been left on the pavement outside my property since 13/1/26. It is a trip hazard and difficult to lift and move.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Marlow Road, Anerley, Greater London

item.title: Blocked Drain Victoria Road Pavement, 15th January
item.description:
The drain on the pavement ramp on Victoria Road is blocked. Causing a large puddle in the pavement and the water runs down the pavement and into the doorways of the houses on Whitehorse hill

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Victoria Road, Elmstead, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Possible sink hole, 15th January
item.description:
There appears to be a potential sinkhole forming outside the garage on Pickford Lane, adjacent to Sainsbury’s. Following heavy rainfall today, a water-filled depression has developed in the road, which vehicles are currently driving through. The surrounding tarmac, particularly nearest the pavement, appears raised and uneven. Due to these conditions, there is concern that this may indicate the early stages of a sinkhole rather than a standard pothole.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 48A, Avenue Road, Welling, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The pavement surface is uneven and badly deteriorated, with multiple cracks and sunken sections, 15th January
item.description:
Tree roots are lifting and distorting the tarmac, causing raised and sloping areas. There are also broken edges between paving slabs and tarmac, creating trip hazards. After rainfall, water pools in the depressions, increasing the risk of slips. This pavement presents a significant trip hazard, particularly for pedestrians, elderly people, wheelchair users, and those with prams or pushchairs. The uneven surface and root damage make it difficult to navigate safely.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Murray Avenue, Widmore, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The lamp post has been accidentally reversed into, 15th January
item.description:
The lamp post is leaning over, it has been cordoned off with tape.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Pickhurst Green, Hayes, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
